title: COLLEGE OF ART AND BUILT ENVIRONMENT
subtitle: Entry requirements for Architecture programme

content.heading: Faculty of Built Environment
content.content: The Faculty of Built Environment is a leading institution in the field of built environment. It offers a range of programmes in architecture, construction technology and management, quantity surveying and construction economics, development planning, human settlement planning, and land economy and real estate.

content.heading: WASSCE/SSSCE Applicants
content.content: Below are the undergraduate programmes offered under the Faculty of Built Environment and their respective entry requirements for WASSCE and SSSCE applicants.

content.tipContent: All applicants must ensure that they meet the minimum general entry requirements in addition to the programme-specific requirements listed above.

content.heading: BSc Architecture
content.content: The BSc Architecture programme prepares students for professional practice in architectural design and construction.

content.heading: Core Subjects
points: Credit passes in English Language
Credit passes in Mathematics
Credit passes in Integrated Science

content.heading: Elective Subjects
content.description: Credit passes in Mathematics and any TWO from the following options:
points: Technical: Technical Drawing or Engineering Science, Woodwork or Building Construction, Metalwork
General Science: Biology, Chemistry, Physics
Visual Art: General Knowledge in Art, Graphic Design, Picture Making
General Arts: Economics, Geography
'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics
'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from the following groups
Option i: Three (3) Subjects from Group A (Technical/Science)
Option ii: Three (3) Subjects from Group B (Visual Art/General Art)
Option iii: Three (3) Subject Combinations from Groups A and B
A pass in General Paper is mandatory
Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application
Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level or HND
An applicant must have demonstrated interest in the area of Architectural Design
Applicants may be required to pass a written and an oral examination after pre-qualification exercise

content.tipContent: Experience at an Architect's Office or familiarity with computer drafting techniques alone is not a special advantage. The Department shall not regard these as substitutes for the minimum entry requirements.

content.heading: BSc Construction Technology and Management
content.content: The BSc Construction Technology and Management programme prepares students for professional practice in construction technology and management.

content.heading: Core Subjects
points: Credit passes in English Language
Credit passes in Mathematics
Credit passes in Integrated Science

content.heading: Elective Subjects
content.description: Credit passes in Mathematics and any Two (2) from the following options:
points: Technical: Technical Drawing or Engineering Science, Woodwork, Building Construction, and Metalwork
Science: Chemistry, and Physics
General Art: Economics, and Geography
'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics
'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in Mathematics and any TWO (2) from the following options:
Group A: Physics, and Chemistry
Group B: Geography, Economics, Technical Drawing, and Building Construction
Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application
Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level or HND
An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview
Candidates must also pass an interview

content.heading: BSc Quantity Surveying and Construction Economics
content.content: The BSc Quantity Surveying and Construction Economics programme prepares students for professional practice in quantity surveying and construction economics.

content.heading: Core Subjects
points: Credit passes in English Language
Credit passes in Mathematics
Credit passes in Integrated Science

content.heading: Elective Subjects
content.description: Credit passes in Mathematics and any Two (2) from the following:
points: Chemistry
Economics
Geography
Technical Drawing
Building Construction
Physics
'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics
'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in Mathematics and any TWO (2) from the following: Physics, Chemistry, Geography, Economics, Building Construction and Technical Drawing
Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application
Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level or HND
An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview
Candidates must also pass an interview

content.heading: BSc Development Planning
content.content: The BSc Development Planning programme prepares students for professional practice in development planning.

content.heading: Core Subjects
points: Credit passes in English Language
Credit passes in Mathematics
Credit passes in Integrated Science

content.heading: Elective Subjects
content.description: Credit passes in THREE (3) Elective Subjects as follows:
points: Option 1: THREE (3) Electives from Group A, including Geography
Option 2: Two (2) from Group A, including Geography and One (1) from Group B

content.heading: Subject Groups
points: Group A: Economics, Introduction to Business Management, Geography, Government, Elective Mathematics, General Knowledge in Art
Group B: Accounting, Technical Drawing, Graphic Design, Picture Making, Sculpture, and Painting
'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics
'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects from the groups below:
Option (a): All Subjects from Group A, including Geography
Option (b): Two (2) subjects from Group A, including Geography, and one (1) subject from Group B

content.heading: Subject Groups
points: GROUP A: Economics, Geography and Government
GROUP B: Mathematics, Statistics, General Knowledge in Art, Accounting and Business Management
Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application
Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level
An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview
Candidates must also pass an interview

content.heading: BSc Human Settlement Planning
content.content: The BSc Human Settlement Planning programme prepares students for professional practice in human settlement planning.

content.heading: Core Subjects
points: Credit passes in English Language
Credit passes in Mathematics
Credit passes in Integrated Science

content.heading: Elective Subjects
content.description: Credit passes in THREE (3) Subjects as follows:
points: Option 1: THREE (3) Subjects in Group A including Geography
Option 2: TWO (2) Subjects in Group A, including Geography, and ONE (1) from Group B

content.heading: Subject Groups
points: GROUP A: Economics, Introduction to Business Management, Geography, Government, Mathematics, General Knowledge in Art
GROUP B: Accounting, Technical Drawing, Graphic Design, Picture Making, Sculpture Painting
'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics
'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in TWO (2) from Group A and ONE (1) from Group B, plus a pass in General Paper

content.heading: Subject Groups
points: GROUP A: Economics, Geography, and Government
GROUP B: Mathematics, Statistics, Art, Accounting, and Business Management
Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application
Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level
Higher National Diploma (HND), Construction Technician Course (Part III) or Professional Draughtmanship Certificates with a minimum of 5 years' experience in draughtsmanship
An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview

content.heading: BSc Land Economy / BSc Real Estate
content.content: The BSc Land Economy / BSc Real Estate programme prepares students for professional practice in land economy and real estate.

content.heading: Core Subjects
points: Credit passes in English Language
Credit passes in Mathematics
Credit passes in Integrated Science

content.heading: Elective Subjects
content.description: Credit passes in THREE subjects from the following:
points: Option (a): Economics, Geography and a third subject relevant to the Land Economy Programme, preferably Accounting, Business Management, Government, Business Mathematics, French, Literature in English, History, Building Construction, Technical Drawing and Mathematics

Option (b): Economics, and TWO (2) other subjects from the following: Elective Mathematics, Geography, Accounting, Business Management, Business Mathematics, Government, French, Building Construction, Technical Drawing, and General Knowledge in Art
'O' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics
'A' Level or equivalent: Credit passes in THREE (3) subjects, two of which shall be Economics and Geography, at a grade not below C
Preference will be given to a third subject in Mathematics, Government or History
Candidates must also pass the General Paper
Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application
Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level, OR should hold a Diploma/HND in Estate Management
An applicant may be required to pass a qualifying examination which shall form the basis for short-listing of candidates for an interview
Candidates must also pass an interview

Candidates with OND or HND in Estate Management or other relevant Diploma qualification from a recognized University or Polytechnic with CWA of 70% and above after a successful interview would be admitted into the second year of the Programme

Other Diploma holders with less than 70% as their CWA would be required to have three years' work experience in the real estate industry and in addition pass an interview to be admitted into first year of the Programme

content.tipContent: This applies to both BSc Land Economy and BSc Real Estate programmes.
